intro: Enkianthus quinqueflorus, commonly known as the five-flowered enkianthus, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features dark green, elliptical leaves. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade to full sun. Enkianthus quinqueflorus is valued for its ornamental value in gardens and its ecological importance for pollinators.
